com.noctarius.tengi.core.serialization.codec

Interface Encoder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AutoClosableEncoder, Codec

    public interface Encoder
    The Encoder interface defines the encoding part of the Codec contract. It provides a set of write-methods to transform values into a byte-stream. The internal implementation of the wire-protocol byte-stream depends on the chosen Codec and Protocol implementation and serialization and deserialization should not depend on implementation details.

    • Method Detail

      • writeBytes

        void writeBytes(byte[] bytes)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is written as a whole from begin to the end.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeBytes

        void writeBytes(byte[] bytes,
                int offset,
                int length)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is written as a whole beginning from the given offset and as many bytes as defined by the given length will be transferred.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to be written to the buffer
        offset - the offset to begin to read from
        length - the number of bytes to write
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeBoolean

        void writeBoolean(boolean value)

        Transfers the content of a boolean to the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the boolean value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeBitSet

        void writeBitSet(boolean[] values)

        Transfers the content of a boolean-array (or bitSet) to the underlying byte-stream buffer. A bitSet is always written as a whole but the Encoder implementation is free to compact or compress the values before writing, just as the default implementation does. Therefore the wire-protocol depends on the chosen Codec implementation.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        values - the boolean-array (or bitSet) values to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeByte

        void writeByte(int value)

        Transfers the content of a byte to the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the byte value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeUnsignedByte

        void writeUnsignedByte(short value)

        Transfers the content of an unsigned byte to the underlying byte-stream buffer. It is up to the Encoder implementation how to write the value to the buffer. Therefore the wire-protocol depends on the chosen Codec implementation.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the unsigned byte value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        com.noctarius.tengi.core.impl.Validate.ValidationException - whenever value is smaller than 0 or greater than 255
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeShort

        void writeShort(short value)

        Transfers the content of a short to the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the short value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeChar

        void writeChar(char value)

        Transfers the content of a char to the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the char value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeInt32

        void writeInt32(int value)

        Transfers the content of an int with 32 bits to the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the int32 value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeCompressedInt32

        void writeCompressedInt32(int value)

        Transfers the content of an int with 32 bits to the underlying byte-stream buffer. Compared to writeInt32(int) this method writes the 32 bits compressed to the stream, whereas the actual compression depends on the chosen Codec implementation.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the int32 value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeInt64

        void writeInt64(long value)

        Transfers the content of an int with 64 bits to the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the int64 value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeCompressedInt64

        void writeCompressedInt64(long value)

        Transfers the content of an int with 64 bits to the underlying byte-stream buffer. Compared to writeInt64(long) this method writes the 64 bits compressed to the stream, whereas the actual compression depends on the chosen Codec implementation.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the int64 value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeFloat

        void writeFloat(float value)

        Transfers the content of a float to the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the float value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeDouble

        void writeDouble(double value)

        Transfers the content of a double to the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the double value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeString

        void writeString(String value)

        Transfers the content of a string to the underlying byte-stream buffer. How the string content is written to the stream depends on the chosen Codec implementation and might offer ASCII and UTF-8 or other options but doesn't have to.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the double value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeObject

        void writeObject(Object object)
          throws Exception

        Transfers a non-null object to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The content itself will be serialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to tag the type of the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        object - the object value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements
        NullPointerException - whenever the given object is null
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • writeNullableObject

        void writeNullableObject(Object object)
                  throws Exception

        Transfers a nullable object to the underlying byte-stream buffer. A marker bit is written to the stream to identify the object was null or actual object content is about to follow up. The content itself will be serialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to tag the type of the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        object - the object value to be written to the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • writeBytes

        default void writeBytes(String fieldName,
                        byte[] bytes)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is written as a whole from begin to the end.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might decide to write the value to the stream but is not required to.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to be written to the buffer
        fieldName - the name of the field to be written, strictly for debugging purpose only
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

      • writeBytes

        default void writeBytes(String fieldName,
                        byte[] bytes,
                        int offset,
                        int length)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is written as a whole beginning from the given offset and as many bytes as defined by the given length will be transferred.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might decide to write the value to the stream but is not required to.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to be written to the buffer
        offset - the offset to begin to read from
        length - the number of bytes to write
        fieldName - the name of the field to be written, strictly for debugging purpose only
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

                         boolean[] values)

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might decide to write the value to the stream but is not required to.

        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements

        default void writeObject(String fieldName,
                         Object object)
                  throws Exception

        Transfers a non-null object to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The content itself will be serialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to tag the type of the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        NullPointerException - whenever the given object is null
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • writeNullableObject

        default void writeNullableObject(String fieldName,
                                 Object object)
                          throws Exception

        Transfers a nullable object to the underlying byte-stream buffer. A marker bit is written to the stream to identify the object was null or actual object content is about to follow up. The content itself will be serialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to tag the type of the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might decide to write the value to the stream but is not required to.

        Parameters:

        fieldName - the name of the field to be written, strictly for debugging purpose only
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • getWritableMemoryBuffer

        WritableMemoryBuffer getWritableMemoryBuffer()
        Returns the internally stored WritableMemoryBuffer to store raw data directly. This is not recommended and should be avoided whenever possible!
        Returns:
        the wrapped WritableMemoryBuffer instance
